intro: Agnesia amapana, commonly known as the Amapana agnesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Agnesia amapana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
